Cosmosis Getdist Wrapper

Class to load Cosmosis chains and return getdist.mcsamples object.

class cosmosis_getdist.loadCosmosisMCSamples(filename)

Loads cosmosis output chains and returns a getdist.MCSamples object that can be plotted using getdist.

chainfile

File name of cosmosis output chains.

Type:

str

metadata

Metadata from cosmosis file.

Type:

list of str

columnnames

List of columns names (first line in cosmosis metadata)

Type:

np.array of str

sampler_type

Sampler used to generate chains. Currently only supports nested sampling.

Type:

str

chains

Array with the chains from cosmosis file

Type:

np.array

indices

Indices of the columns that correspond to the loglikelihood, weights and sampled variables.

Type:

np.array

paramnames

Array of the parameter names.

Type:

np.array of str

samples

Array with the sampled parameters from the chains.

Type:

np.array

loglikes

Array with the log likelihood from the chains.

Type:

np.array

weights

Array with the weights.

Type:

np.array

labels

List of the labels for the parameters.

Type:

list

ranges (

obj: dict): Dictionary for each parameters and its corresponding minimum and maximum values.

get_chains()

Gets chains from the cosmosis file.

get_columnnames()

Takes the first element in the metadata list, containing the column names. Then, the parameters are split by tabs, returning an array of the column names.

get_indices()

Locates the index of “post” and “weight” elements in the column names array in order to delete them from the array.

get_labels()

Obtains labels and categories of variables from the parameter names list, creating lists for the labels and categories themselves. Unnecessary variables are also removed from both.

get_loglikes()

Gets the log likelihood column from chains.

get_metadata()

Opens user inputted file and removes lines starting with ‘#’, returning each line as an element in a list.

get_paramnames()

Gets parameter names from metadata.

get_ranges()

Gets the minimum and maximum values of the parameters and puts them into a dictionary.

get_sampler_type()

Sampler type from the cosmosis metadata. Only supports ‘nested’ as of now.

get_samples()

Gets columns of the chains that correspon to the variables being sampled.

get_weights()

Gets the weights column from chains.

make_MC_samples()

Creates getdisk.mcsamples object with the samples, weights, log likelihoods, parameter names, parameters ranges, and parameter labels from the cosmosis file.
